benchmark_details.name: Hybrid and Unitary Fine-Tuning of Large Language Models
benchmark_details.overview: This paper presents a hybrid fine-tuning framework integrating parameter-efficient methods for large language models, achieving improved performance and reduced resource consumption across multiple benchmarks.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To explore and evaluate parameter-efficient fine-tuning techniques for large language models.

data.source: Four standard NLP benchmarks: GLUE, GSM8K, MT-Bench, HumanEval

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on model performance across the selected benchmarks.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better performance; metrics such as BLEU score measure translation quality.
